item.title: Albanese government turns defence sights north, completing $355m upgrade to RAAF Base Tindal
item.description: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.

item.title: Australia's heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
item.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

item.title: Search for alleged triple murderer Julian Ingram may be like 'finding a needle in a haystack'
item.description: A former deputy commissioner of police who was involved in the eight-year search for one of Australia's most notorious fugitives says finding alleged Lake Cargelligo triple murderer Julian Ingram will be difficult.

item.title: Sydney's landfills are set to reach capacity by 2030 sparking controversial plans to take trash to the regions
item.description: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

item.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
item.description: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

item.title: Scientists warn microplastics testing could be overestimating extent in human body
item.description: Queensland researchers lead calls for a standardised approach to microplastics testing, amid growing concerns about the impact of the pollutants on the human body.

item.title: Alex de Minaur receives feedback from Carlos Alcaraz after Australian Open loss
item.description: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

item.title: Documents reveal widespread misconduct, complaints, at Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra
item.description: Disturbing allegations of verbal and physical mistreatment of toddlers, poor supervision and repeated staffing failures have emerged in documents about Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra.

item.title: Sydney Festival 2026: Our favourite shows from Lacrima to Wake
item.description: A debauched Irish wake, a three-hour French play about a royal wedding dress and British electro-pop band Hot Chip were some of the best of the festival.

item.title: 'Incredibly abnormal' temperatures 20C above average in parts of Australia — as it happened
item.description: Towns in New South Wales and Queensland are sweltering today amid a record-breaking heatwave, as firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes in Victoria.

item.title: Rado Vidisic, A-League title winning coach and Australian football figure, dies aged 64
item.description: Rado Vidosic, a highly-regarded Australian football figure and coach across a number of A-League clubs and teams, dies of cancer aged 64.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz approaching 'unmatchable' level after mastering powers of concentration
item.description: Twelve months ago, Carlos Alcaraz was outwitted by a hobbled Novak Djokovic. This time around, against a rampaging hometown hero, there would be no slipping up.

item.title: Judge orders ICE head to face court as Trump shakes up Minnesota operation
item.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

item.title: Floor collapse at Toll warehouse causes statewide vaccine shortages
item.description: A section of floor has caved-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

item.title: Busselton ratepayers set to foot $60 million bill after performing arts centre cost blowout
item.description: Residents demand answers after the cost of a performing arts centre in the state's South West more than tripled its original allocated budget.

item.title: Meet the 2026 Trailblazers changing regional Australia
item.description: Jayden is helping youth go from feeling "lost, angry and unheard" to "proud strong and seen". He's one of our 2026 Trailblazers, announced today.

item.title: University of Southern Queensland astronomer discovers 'potentially habitable' planet candidate
item.description: An international team of astronomers led from regional Queensland finds an exoplanet 150 light-years away with a 50 per cent chance of having liquid water on its surface.

item.title: TikTok settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial against Meta, YouTube
item.description: TikTok agrees to settle a landmark lawsuit on social media addiction, the same day the trial was due to start against Meta and YouTube.

item.title: Diamonds call up Matilda Garrett for Jamaica series as Australia eyes Commonwealth Games
item.description: Australia's netball hierarchy settles on a replacement for an injured defender ahead of the Diamonds' three-Test series against Jamaica.

item.title: Liberal frontbencher says Morrison's proposal to register imams 'a worthwhile discussion'
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg says Australian Muslims need to take some responsibility for extremist incidents and that a proposal for a register of Islamic preachers is worth considering.

item.title: Tongans frustrated with Trump's 'collective punishment' of foreign nationals
item.description: The United States bars Tongans from short-term visits or travel for tourism and business purposes, saying too many are overstaying their visas.

item.title: Mount Lawley diamond jewellery shop targeted in suspected ram raid
item.description: Thieves target a Mount Lawley jewellery store in an early morning ram raid, leaving empty cabinets and a trail of destruction.

item.title: Daylesford crash driver will be compelled to give evidence at inquest, coroner rules
item.description: A Victorian coroner has ruled that a driver with diabetes who ploughed into a crowd outside a regional pub, killing five people, will be compelled to give evidence at an inquest.

item.title: Man charged with hate speech Brandan Koschel had posted photos alongside Neo-Nazis
item.description: Brandan Koschel had posted blurred images of himself standing next to prominent Neo-Nazis on a social media account earlier this month.

item.title: Why haven't police labelled Perth's Invasion Day rally incident terrorism? Here's what we know
item.description: Identifying ideological motivations behind attacks is critical to separating terrorism from other events just designed to cause fear, an extremism expert told the ABC.

item.title: Tony Abbott intervenes in Liberal leadership battle calling on right to unite to oust Sussan Ley
item.description: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has intervened in the Liberal leadership race, urging conservatives to unite behind either Angus Taylor or Andrew Hastie in their bid to oust Sussan Ley from the top job.

item.title: Coco Gauff backed by Iga Świątek after smashing racquet at Australian Open
item.description: Iga Świątek defends Coco Gauff after footage was shown of the American smashing a racquet at the Australian Open.

item.title: Microplastics triple in Sydney's waterways in three years, report finds
item.description: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

item.title: Accidental 'crying horse' toy becomes Spring Festival bestseller in China
item.description: A dour-faced toy horse — the result of a manufacturing error — has gone viral in China, with some workers saying its expression mirrors their long hours and workplace stress.

item.title: Woman accused of paying secret kickbacks to surgeons to use medical devices at Brisbane hospital faces court
item.description: The finance manager is one of four people who were charged last month, following an investigation involving the Crime and Corruption Commission and the Queensland Office of the Health Ombudsman.

item.title: Hoodoo Gurus' Dave Faulkner lashes One Nation use of song at March for Australia Rally
item.description: Faulkner says One Nation and its supporters can "take a running jump" after his band's song was used at an Australia Day rally held by the party, and he's not bothered by party supporters trolling him on social media.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Accessory to murder charges dropped in cold case of NSW mother Pauline Sowry
item.description: Leon Boeyen, who has been in prison since May on two charges relating to the 1993 disappearance of the NSW woman, wept as he learned he would be released.

item.title: Tourist mauled by snow leopard while trying to take photo, Chinese media reports
item.description: A female skier has been mauled by a snow leopard on her way back to her hotel in China after she attempted to get a selfie.

item.title: 'Doomsday Clock' set to 85 seconds to midnight, closer than ever to catastrophe
item.description: Atomic scientists set the Doomsday Clock to 85 seconds midnight, with threats such as nuclear weapons and conflicts pushing humanity closer than ever to the point of annihilation.

item.title: Leigh Geoffrey Sushames pleads guilty to murder of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith
item.description: The man accused of fatally shooting Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith pleads guilty to murder in a Devonport court.

item.title: Mass wildlife rescue underway with flying foxes entangled at golf club driving range
item.description: A mass wildlife rescue is again underway at the Noosa Golf Club after dozens of flying foxes became trapped in netting at its driving range for the fourth time this month.

item.title: Why UFC 325 is a collision between Alex Volkanovski's glorious past and uncertain future
item.description: An end of an era looms for Alex Volkanovski as he prepares for his first title defence on home soil, but ahead of UFC 325, Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter is still the nation's gold standard.

item.title: Littleproud open to Ley meeting after Nationals spill resolved
item.description: Nationals Leader David Littleproud will stare down a leadership tilt from Queensland MP Colin Boyce, though colleagues say it is unlikely the challenger will secure enough votes for a spill.

item.title: At least 16 structures lost in Otways fire with heatwave still impacting Victoria's north-east
item.description: At least 16 structures have been destroyed by the Carlisle River fire in Victoria's Otways, with a strong wind change late yesterday afternoon impacting another 1,000 hectares.

item.title: Remains found during search in Tasmanian bush for missing tourist Celine Cremer
item.description: The bushwalker who found human remains while searching for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer says he "went into shock" after coming across bones in dense Tasmanian forest.

item.title: Off-contract Usman Khawaja keen to extend Big Bash career with Brisbane Heat
item.description: In the aftermath of his international retirement, Usman Khawaja is keen to extend his Big Bash career, with his preference to strike a new deal with the Brisbane Heat.

item.title: Wine Australia's export report for 2025 shows consumers sobering up as cost of living bites
item.description: Global demand for Australian wine is continuing to dwindle, with the latest Wine Australia export report showing an 8 per cent decrease in 2025 as consumers opt for alcohol-free trends.

item.title: Teenager accused of electric motorbike death in Perth's north pleads not guilty to manslaughter charge
item.description: A teenage boy accused of killing a 59-year-old woman while riding an unlicensed high-powered electric motorbike in Perth's north has pleaded not guilty to manslaughter.

item.title: 'One-off' literary festival, Constellations, to go ahead in lieu of Writers' Week
item.description: A community literary festival will go ahead in the wake of the cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week, but those involved say it is not a replacement for the original event.

item.title: Counterfeit Botox still being imported into Australia, months after regulator first raised alarm
item.description: Counterfeit Botox vials were packaged in branded boxes that appear like a genuine product, according to a renewed warning from the Therapeutic Goods Administration.

item.description: The alert level for a blaze burning north of Perth is downgraded, after it threatened lives and homes on Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Iranian doctor who fled to Australia after operating on massacre victims estimates death toll in tens of thousands
item.description: In one of the most harrowing accounts yet, a doctor who fled Iran for Australia recounts trying to save bullet-riddled victims of the government crackdown on protests.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana brings rain relief for remote WA inland cattle stations
item.description: Weather associated with a former cyclone has drenched parts of Western Australia's inland region, bringing relief for pastoralists who had received very little rain for the previous 12 months.

item.description: Less than a year after the Reserve Bank started cutting rates, the prospect of a rate rise is a political nightmare for a treasurer hoping for clear air.

item.description: China's ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, questions the Albanese government's ethics in wanting to return the Port of Darwin to Australian hands.

item.description: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of jailed former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol, is sentenced to prison by a Seoul court.

item.description: A man, who was stripped of more than a dozen guns after police found multiple copies of Adolf Hitler's manifesto at his home, is fighting to have his weapons licence reinstated by a court.

item.title: Doctors failed to tell authorities of driver's vision impairment before fatal Adelaide crash, inquest hears
item.description: A coronial inquest will investigate why three doctors failed to alert relevant authorities that a man was unfit to drive due to vision impairment in the years before he caused a crash which killed a mother of four.

item.description: The two-and-a-half year search for a missing Belgian tourist has led to the discovery of bones, which may mean closure is not far away.

item.description: A gemstone dealer has received a four-month suspended prison sentence for illegally mining more than 8 tonnes of turquoise ore at a Northern Territory sacred site.

item.title: First Nations urge stronger response after alleged Invasion Day rally attack
item.description: First Nations leaders have urged governments to take stronger action in response to the alleged attack at an Invasion Day rally in Perth on Monday. Social Justice Commissioner Katie Kiss says failing to do so "sends a message that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people do not matter".

item.description: Firefighting conditions have improved around the fire that burnt through properties near the town of Gellibrand in Victoria's south-west, but crews warn the blaze is still not under control.

item.description: Consumer advocates fear a rate hike when the RBA board meets next week could be the "straw that breaks the camel's back" for borrowers in mortgage stress.

item.title: GPS trackers in e-waste from Australia reveal 'likely' illegal exports to South-East Asia
item.description: A not-for-profit environmental group put GPS devices in 35 e-waste items and dropped them off at recycling locations in four Australian capital cities. Here's what they found.

item.title: The curious case of Pritam Singh, Singapore's ousted opposition leader
item.description: Even for a de facto one-party state, the ruling People's Action Party's decision to dictate who runs Singapore's opposition is remarkable.

item.title: Novak Djokovic feels disrespected ahead of Australian Open semi against Jannik Sinner
item.description: Playing with a chip on his shoulder or feeling slighted is often when 10-time Australian Open champion Novak Djokovic produces his best results.

item.title: As Donald Trump weighs up actions, Iranians send the US a message to 'please help'
item.description: Protesters in Iran are begging US President Donald Trump to launch military action to help topple the Islamic regime. But could it happen?

item.title: Two aspirants who are unlikely to suit the times vie for Liberal leadership
item.description: Andrew Hastie and Angus Taylor both want to run against Sussan Ley. But the two right-wingers cannot afford to split the conservative vote on which their tilts would rely.

item.title: Elena Rybakina takes the long road back into Australian Open final and best in the world conversation
item.description: After being the forgotten figure when it comes to conversations about elite women's players, Elena Rybakina has put her name back up in lights.

item.title: Adelaide median house price grows $50,000 in a quarter, reaching $925,000 according to Valuer-General data
item.description: Experts are forecasting continued growth this year as Adelaide's metropolitan median house sale price inches closer to $1 million, according to Valuer-General data.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: BAFTA nominations, a new cricket captain and departing pandas
item.description: Think you've been paying attention to the news cycle?

item.title: Authorities warn NSW residents to stay vigilant as heatwave draws on
item.description: As parts of western and south-western New South Wales enter their sixth day of temperatures above 40 degrees, authorities are urging people not to become complacent.

item.title: The makers of AACTA-nominated movies and TV shows discuss the Australian screen industry
item.description: Ahead of next week's AACTA Awards, the makers of frontrunners Bring Her Back, Kangaroo and Apple Cider Vinegar share their thoughts on the state of the local screen industry.

item.title: Queensland Police refuse to release report following review into treatment of women in State Emergency Service
item.description: The ABC understands that some female volunteers aired allegations of sexism and discrimination as part of the review, which was undertaken in early 2024.

item.title: Steven Johnson to stand trial for alleged Victorian cold case murder of Christopher Jarvis
item.description: A landlord has been ordered to stand trial over the cold case death of his tenant Christopher Jarvis, who disappeared from his home near Warrnambool 20 years ago.

item.title: A mid-match coffee break, Aryna Sabalenka's hindrance and a finalist's flashback — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka's abnormal sound is punished, an Aussie has a mid-match coffee break and a women's finalist has an unsettling flashback. Here are the quick hits from day 12 at the Australian Open.

item.title: Shoppers remember 'old days' at grocery store that has operated since late 19th century
item.description: A New South Wales grocery store has been operating since before there was refrigeration, electricity and even Vegemite.

item.title: Hastie says he doesn't have support to challenge for Liberal leadership — as it happened
item.description: Andrew Hastie will not contest the Liberal leadership, clearing the way for a possible challenge to Sussan Ley from Angus Taylor.

item.title: Trump tariffs could 'isolate' the US and create new trading blocs
item.description: In the past fortnight, US President Donald Trump has threatened tariffs against at least 10 countries. Some experts say the Trump administration's tariff policy is leading to the creation of new trading blocs, and isolating the United States.

item.title: Gold, silver plummet ahead of Fed chair announcement — as it happened
item.description: The prices of gold and silver have plummeted in Asian trade as markets prepare for a surprise Federal Reserve announcement, and the ASX 200 has finished the week on a negative note. Look back on the day's finance news in our business blog.

item.title: Former AIS athletes blast handling of documentary amid fears it could 'damage' historical abuse victims
item.description: Former AIS athletes who claim they were physically and psychologically abused while living at the AIS have urged Channel Nine to shutter a documentary about the history of the institute.

item.title: Thousands of flying foxes die, hundreds rescued, amid record-breaking SA heatwaves
item.description: A deadly combination of heatwaves has all but decimated a colony of flying foxes in SA's south-east, with surviving bats taken in by conservationists.

item.title: SA Arts Minister Andrea Michaels to quit politics after state election
item.description: Andrea Michaels will not recontest her seat of Enfield, in Adelaide's inner north, but will remain in the cabinet until the March election.

item.title: Inpex under investigation after suspected sulphur dioxide exposure leaves worker in hospital
item.description: The Australian Workers' Union has raised concerns after a worker at Inpex's Ichthys gas facility was allegedly exposed to sulphur dioxide and hospitalised, prompting an investigation by the NT workplace safety watchdog.

item.title: Australian Defence Force member charged over army truck crash north-west of Brisbane
item.description: Police charge the 25-year-old over the collision, which left a woman in hospital.

item.title: Celine Cremer searcher speaks of 'shock' at finding human remains
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Pakistan down Australia by 22 runs in first match of T20 World Cup warm up series
item.description: Despite the best efforts of evergreen spinner Adam Zampa, Australia have suffered a 22-run defeat to Pakistan in the first T20 of their World Cup preparations.

item.title: Queenslander launches petition to charge drivers for dangerous rescues amid wild flooding
item.description: A flood victim is leading a campaign to force drivers who knowingly enter floodwater to pay for their rescue.

item.title: Men flee four-wheel drive at flooded Cape York crossing
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: From Bondi to Perth, questions are being raised about the safety of public events
item.description: As the Invasion Day rally incident and Bondi terror attack shatter expectations that people should be able to gather peacefully in public places, Australians may be facing a new normal.

item.title: WA heatwave causes almost $1 million in crop losses to Gascoyne fruitgrowers
item.description: Growers in WA's Gascoyne food bowl have lost an estimated $1 million of fruit, with another heatwave on the way.

item.title: Genetically modified purple tomatoes bound for fruit shops after regulator approval
item.description: The purple tomato was altered to make it taste better and boost nutrition.

item.title: Polar bear walks on ice with cubs
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: 'Good news' for Norway's polar bears, which are growing fatter despite loss of sea ice
item.description: Polar bears of the Svalbard archipelago have surprised scientists by growing fatter, despite shrinking sea ice, with one theory that the bears are including reindeer and walrus in their diet.

item.title: Teenage bushwalker found dead in the Blue Gum Forest in Blue Mountains National Park
item.description: Police say the teen and his 17-year-old friend became separated after setting out on a three-day hike.

item.title: Kevin Muscat's Shanghai Port one of nine Chinese Super League clubs hit with corruption sanctions
item.description: Kevin Muscat's chances of steering Shanghai Port to a third successive Chinese Super League title have taken a hit with the club to start the season on minus five points after the Chinese FA completed a wide-ranging investigation into corruption.

item.title: Look back at historic V-Set passenger service
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Rare earths mine at centre of Trump-Albanese deal yet to materialise after years in the making
item.description: It is the Central Australian mine promised to help upset China's dominance of the rare earths market worldwide, and bring hundreds of jobs to Australia. But where is it?

item.title: The US wants to control Venezuela's finances. These armed groups could make it difficult
item.description: The US plan to "recover" Venezuela could spark a domestic backlash in a country that is already heavily divided among various armed groups that have political interests.

item.title: Donald Trump has Iran in his sights, but what is his endgame?
item.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

item.title: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan says Lachie Neale having his 'best pre-season in a long time'
item.description: Lachie Neale has been in the spotlight all summer after giving up the Brisbane co-captaincy amid his highly-publicised marriage breakdown but the Lions brass believe the premiership winner is physically in the midst of his best pre-season in some years.

item.title: Live: Incensed Zverev hits back as Alcaraz hobbled by injury in semifinal
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz starts struggling with an apparent groin strain after taking control in his men's singles semifinal against Alexander Zverev, who hits back to win the third set. Follow live.

item.title: Australia closely monitoring Nipah virus, no change to border control
item.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

item.title: Vision of a police shooting involving an alleged stolen car in Geelong
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sussan Ley issues ultimatum to David Littleproud as she announces temporary shadow ministry
item.description: The under-fire Liberal leader has given seven existing frontbenchers carriage of the portfolios vacated by Nationals, with a threat to leader David Littleproud the arrangements could be made permanent.

item.title: Nine Radio sold for cut-price $56m to pub tycoon Arthur Laundy as it spends $850m on outdoor ad company QMS
item.description: Arthur Laundy's Laundy Family Office acquires a network that includes Melbourne's top-rating talk station 3AW, Sydney's 2GB and outspoken conservative presenters such as Ben Fordham and Tom Elliott.

item.title: Katarapko fire in South Australia's Riverland
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: SA man arrested for allegedly lighting multiple fires during Riverland heatwave
item.description: A 49-year-old South Australian man has been arrested for allegedly lighting multiple fires in the state's Riverland.

item.title: Alex Pretti in a scuffle with immigration officers
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donald Trump shares video of Alex Pretti confrontation with agents 11 days before shooting
item.description: United States President Donald Trump has shared a video on Truth Social showing Alex Pretti in a confrontation with federal immigration agents 11 days before the intensive care nurse was fatally shot during a separate encounter with Border Patrol agents.

item.title: Police line search begins after human remains found in search for Celine Cremer
item.description: Tasmania Police says six experts have been flown in via helicopter to conduct a line search of the Arthur River, where human remains were found this week.

item.title: Adelaide Hills man completes 23-year steam locomotive build
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bruce Springsteen releases anti-ICE protest song Streets of Minneapolis
item.description: The Boss has blasted the Trump administration and ICE agents in a new song responding to "the state terror being visited" on Minneapolis and dedicated to Renee Good and Alex Pretti.

item.title: Government lands last-minute hospital funding deal with states
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising an extra $25 billion for public hospitals.

item.title: Machine capable of making millions of illegal cigarettes seized in Sydney
item.description: A machine which can produce millions of black market cigarettes has been seized in a raid in north-west Sydney, as the fight against the illegal tobacco trade heats up.

item.title: Cannington greyhound racing 'carnage' prompts phase out calls
item.description: Four dogs were injured and two euthanased after a greyhound racing event in Cannington this week, escalating calls to end the sport.

item.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
item.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

item.title: Charge laid after allegedly stolen vehicle crashes into Geelong school bus, officer opens fire
item.description: A 43-year-old woman has been charged with handling stolen goods after a dramatic incident that saw police open fire at a vehicle that allegedly drove at officers after crashing into a bus on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Families frayed by NDIS cuts brace for more change ahead of defining 2026
item.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

item.title: Fugees, Weezer, Spiderbait's classic albums turn 30 in 2026
item.description: From Weezer's raw emotion to the Spice Girls's pop revolution, revisit 10 iconic albums that made 1996 a landmark year in music. Thirty years on, they still define the era.

item.title: Why your sunscreen application might be putting your good intentions to waste
item.description: This is what three experts had to say about how to get the best protection from your sunscreen.

item.title: Canberra woman charged with murder after man found dead in her Braddon unit
item.description: A 37-year-old woman from Canberra's inner north is charged with murder after the body of a 44-year-old man was found in her unit in December.

item.title: FBI seizes Georgia ballots as Trump pursues 2020 election grievance
item.description: Fulton County, which votes overwhelmingly Democratic, has been a target of President Donald Trump since he narrowly lost the 2020 presidential election in Georgia to Democrat Joe Biden.

item.title: Man jailed for injecting girlfriend with meth 24 hours before she died
item.description: A man who injected his girlfriend with methamphetamine in the 24 hours before her sudden death has been jailed for just over nine months — but his sentence was backdated, meaning he will be eligible for release in May.

item.title: New Zealand has refused to join Donald Trump's 'Board of Peace'. What about the rest of the world?
item.description: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

item.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley for Liberal Party leadership
item.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal Party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley next week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

item.title: Tim Picton's brother says seeing CCTV would be 'scarring for me forever'
item.description: In his first interview since the death of his brother Tim, SA's Health Minister Chris Picton reflects on the profound emotional impact of the loss on their family, his reluctance to watch the CCTV footage, and his brother's inability to become an organ donor "because of the coronial process".

item.title: Man jailed over antisemitic graffiti spree in Sydney fails to have sentence overturned
item.description: Mohommed Farhat's lawyers were urging the court to overturn the sentence on appeal and replace it with an intensive correction order which could have seen him released.

item.title: More than $370 million now allocated for Victorian bushfire recovery support
item.description: The state and federal governments will substantially increase financial support for 23 Victorian local government areas devastated by bushfires this month.

item.title: Gold and silver prices drop ahead of announcement on new US Federal Reserve chair
item.description: Gold and silver prices fall sharply in Asian trade, sparked by reports US President Donald Trump is set to announce a new US Federal Reserve chair.
